result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Perkie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
OWI 6th

Conditions:

Serve 9 months conditional jail time, with work release/huber.  May be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.

Defendant not to possess or consume alcohol and must submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine to monitor compliance.  No entry into bars or taverns.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

miscConds.notes:
All costs - fine, forfeiture, and surcharges, including blood draw reimbursement for Richland County - to be collected by DOC.  DOC to refer to Assessment Report.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With work release/huber.  Stayed until on or before May 23, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.  Jail may be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with 16CF63.  Defendant to be eligible for any programming offered by the prison system.  

Counsel have STIPULATED TO 253 DAYS CREDIT; Court so orders.
Concurrent with: 16CF63

Concurrent with 16CF63.  Costs remitted by the Court.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Associated with Charge #1

2 cases called together ( 16CF63 & 14CF44-revocation). Defendant Joshua J. Perkie in custody and in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.Joint recommendation recited.  In 16CF63, court gives colloquy re. waiver of prelim, binds def over. Information has been filed, formal reading waived. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties brought forth on the information. Guilty plea entered in 16CF63. Colloquy.  Court accepts plea/finds def guilty. Firearms warnings given. 

Sentence: 

16CF63: 8 yrs prison: 4 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision, 36 month revocation of license, 36 month IID, AODA assessment and DSP upon relicensing, costs (as a condition of ES).  Defendant is eligible any programming offered by the prison system. 


Sentence after revocation: 

14CF44: 4 yrs prison, 2 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Costs are remitted. Defendant is eligible any programming offered by the prison system.  Parties stipulate to 253 days credit. Concurrent with 16CF63.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
RCSD dispo sheet - "time served"
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Joshua J. Perkie in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin in 14CF44 and for the County of Richland in 14TR1058.  DA states plea agreement whereby she's moving to dismiss 14TR1058 disposition of OWI 5th/6th.  Court notes that SD has written to the Court, requesting her bond $ back.  SD, present in court, states she wants her $ back.  Court orders $ released to SD.  DA makes argument against release of bond to SD.  Atty. Angel concurs with DA Harper; joins DA in the argument against release of the bond money to SD.  Court reviews doc that SD signed when she posted bail and determines that the Court's order for release of the bond shall stand.  Given the release of the bond, Atty. Angel states that def wishes to proceed today to plea/sentencing.

Def pleads no contest to OWI 6th.  Court's colloquy re plea.  Counsel address the Court.

Court orders sentence withheld for 3 years probation.  Conditions:  9 months conditional jail time; AODA/follow through; pay costs as a condition of probation; 36 mo rev; 36 mo IID upon relicensing; $600 plus costs with additional $62 for blood draw; 3 days credit.  Court stays jail until May 23, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.  No drink/test on demand/no taverns.

Felony admonishment provided.

Court permits def to transfer to any jail in the State of Wisconsin that accepts him.  

Def to report to P/P today or tomorrow.

from SD, poster of the bond, to the Court; request to get bond $ back

Court's answer to this request:  "she must produce him - bring him back to be arrested - and only then can I release her from the bond."  Clerk has relayed this information to SD in a phone call on 4-20-15.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-23-2015 03:00 pm

14TR1058/status and 14CF44/plea hearing.  Defendant Joshua J. Perkie in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states that the parties need a reset as parties plan to move next to plea/sentencing.  April 23 at 3.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing at 03-17-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Joshua J. Perkie in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin in 14CF44; DA Harper also appears for county in 14TR1058.  Status in both.  Atty. A states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution; plan to resolve short of trial.  DA's preference is to resolve sooner rather than later.  March 17 at 1:30 set by court for plea hearing in 14CF44 and status in 14TR1058.  Trial dates canceled.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 03-18-2015 03:30 pm
Status conference at 03-18-2015 03:30 pm
Status conference at 03-04-2015 03:30 pm
request from Atty. Angel to move the March 4th status to a later time that day

Status conference at 02-04-2015 09:00 am.
Status conference at 03-04-2015 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 03-20-2015 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person at 03-23-2015 09:00 am.
Status conference at 02-04-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Joshua J. Perkie in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment completed, counsel report on status:  jury trial scheduling requested.  Atty. Angel asks for trial after Feb. 1st - 2 days.  Court directs counsel to look at their calendars and contact JA for scheduling.  Further status set for Feb. 4 at 9.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 3, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Angel for status in 14TR1058 and for prelim in 14CF44.

14CF44 - Def waives right to prelim.  Waiver colloquy.  Information has been filed.  Formal reading waived.  Court states charge and informs def of possible max. penalties.  Def stand mute for entry of NG plea to OWI 5/6.  Atty. Angel requests status scheduling.

14TR continued to Dec. 3 also.  Status conference scheduled for 12-03-2014 at 02:30 pm.
from DMV re. judicidal review-denied as untimely.
Opportunity for Judicial Review
Order Staying Administrative Suspension
$4000 remains as cash bond - the rest has been refunded to the poster SD, as ordered this day by the Court
Same conditions as previous bond.
Preliminary hearing on October 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Angel for adjourned initial and bail review hearing in 14CF44, status in 14TR1058, and initial appearance on yet-to-be-filed bail jumping case. 

DA states that she has not filed the bail j case; wants to talk with opposing counsel about that; asks for def's release from the signature bond in that matter. 

In 14CF44 (felony OWI), defense asks for prelim.  10TR1058 is failure to keep vehicle under control.  

Atty. A states that def wants to waive the 20-day time limit for the prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of time limits.

14CF44 and 14TR1058 set over to Oct. 29 at 9 (prelim in the CF and status in the TR.

Atty. Angel asks that cash bond be reduced to 4k in the CF case.  Court has stated that he will reduce the cash bond in the CF case is the poster took the refunded $ and used it to retain counsel.  Atty. Angel is presently serving as SPD counsel.  DA objects to reduction of cash bond.

Court reduces bond to $4k cash with same conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 10-29-2014 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on September 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
rescheduling request from defense counsel - need to move the Sep. 12th court date
Review hearing on September 12, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Request for bond modification.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Case not called but was mentioned during bail hearing on new bail jumping charges; new court date given of Sep. 12 at 1:15.
DA Harper and no Def at 10:17 a.m.  Warrants requested and ordered in 14TR1058 and 14CF44.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.

DA Harper and Def without counsel.  2 cases called together:  14CF44 and 14TR1058.  Def has petitioned to the court for counsel appointment in the criminal case.  Court questions def to determine if def is eligible for court-appointed counsel.  Court states that def is over the guidelines for court-appointed attorney.  Def states that he has 8k posted to bond.  DA states that, if he has counsel on board, she's not opposed to reducing bond to 5k and allowing the other 3k to be assigned to Atty. Angel, whom def has talked to re retainer in this matter.  

Court reduces bond to 5k cash; the other 3k is to be released to the poster, SD.  Court does not appoint counsel.

DA asks for "assignment of that money - he doesn't just get it back... until that assignment can take place, State objects to release of that money."  Court notes the retainer amounts attorneys have quoted def in the letters he got from them as attachments with his petition for appointment.  Court has suggested that 3k be released so that def can retain Atty. A.  SD opposed to that appointment.

Court sets this matter over one more time for def to continue to explore looking for an attorney; states that, if def can find an attorney who will take 3k or less as retainer, Court would be willing to take the bond down to 5k and assign the rest to whoever that attorney is.

Matter reset to Aug. 20 at 10.  No change in bond amount at this time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 08-20-2014 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua J. Perkie in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def states he has received a copy of the complaint. Commissioner Schwarze informs def of his charges/max possible penalties as well as his right to counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
